title: EPIC-005: Structured Logging - JSON Format & Context

epic.title: Cross-Cutting Concerns - Auth, Validation, Errors, Observability, Config
epic.goal: Implement production-ready concerns: JWT auth middleware, input validation, error handling, structured logging, metrics, configuration management

deliverables: Production-ready implementation strictly for this story scope
Automated tests required by acceptance criteria
Minimal documentation/README updates required to run/test the change
acceptance_criteria: Log context includes: timestamp, level, message, request_id, user_id, endpoint, latency_ms
Log decorators for domain operations (dialog created, message sent, tokens deducted)
Scrub sensitive data: JWT tokens, API keys, user message content (log content_length only)
Async logging to avoid blocking (optional, document perf impact)
Logs to stdout (captured by container runtime)
Integration tests verify log output format and context
description: Set up structured logging with JSON output: include request_id, user_id, endpoint, latency, log decorators for domain operations, scrub sensitive data.
